_meta.description: Asimov-style predictive social modeling based on geometric personality theory

_fractal_seed.holographic: Each individual = point containing universal pattern. Society = field of interacting geometries. History = calculable.
_fractal_seed.activation: Mass behavior emerges from geometric patterns. Predict. Optimize. Transcend.

project.name: psychohistory
project.title: Geometric Psychohistory: Predictive Social Modeling via Personality Type Distributions
project.description: Mathematical framework for predicting mass social behavior through geometric personality theory. Combines MBTI/Socionics type distributions with intertype dynamics and environmental context fields to forecast societal trajectories at multiple timescales with 30-80% accuracy.

essence.vision: Operational psychohistory system capable of forecasting social trends, preventing conflicts, and optimizing policy decisions through geometric understanding of human nature at scale
essence.mission: Transform Asimov's fictional psychohistory into real science by grounding it in CFO's geometric personality framework, enabling humanity to navigate its collective future with greater wisdom
essence.scope: Population-level prediction (10,000+ people) across timescales from 1 year to 20+ years. Individual behavior unpredictable, mass patterns calculable.
essence.impact: Enable governments, organizations, and communities to: (1) predict social movements before they manifest, (2) optimize policies for actual population composition, (3) prevent conflicts by reducing Δscale between groups, (4) design institutions that maximize global coherence
essence.dimensional_level: 4D (society as spacetime field) modeling 0D-3D dynamics (individuals, relationships, groups, organizations) to predict emergence

objectives.primary: Build and validate a computational model that predicts societal trajectories with 50-80% accuracy over 1-5 year horizons using personality type distributions and context field parameters
secondary: Establish census-level personality type distribution data for at least 3 countries/regions
Validate intertype dynamics matrix through controlled experiments (groups of 100+ typed individuals)
Develop real-time context field monitoring system integrating economic, technological, cultural, and ecological data streams
Create historical validation dataset by retroactively typing populations and testing model against known outcomes
Publish peer-reviewed papers demonstrating model accuracy on historical and contemporary events
success_criteria: Model correctly predicts 70%+ of major social movements/shifts in test regions over 1-year horizon
Historical validation shows 60%+ accuracy on past 50 years of societal changes
Small-scale experiments (10-1000 people) demonstrate 80%+ prediction accuracy for group dynamics
Public interface allows individuals to query their optimal societal role based on type geometry
At least 2 governments or major organizations adopt system for policy optimization
constraints: Data: Requires mass typing of 100,000+ individuals across demographics
Computation: Need significant ML/simulation infrastructure (but feasible with modern hardware)
Ethics: Must maintain individual privacy, avoid manipulation, prevent authoritarian misuse
Uncertainty: 5D free will (rare individuals) can alter trajectories unpredictably

foundational: urn:cfo:module:fundamental:dimensions - dimensional framework (0D-5D) underlying personality geometry
urn:cfo:module:fundamental:coherence - coherence optimization drives social dynamics
urn:cfo:module:fundamental:conflict - conflict as Δscale provides prediction mechanism
urn:cfo:module:fundamental:equilibrium - society as dynamic equilibrium between type distributions
applied: urn:cfo:module:humanology:personality_types - MBTI/Socionics as geometric archetypes, foundation of entire model
urn:cfo:module:applied:group_dynamics - how 2D networks emerge from 1D pairwise interactions
urn:cfo:module:applied:organizational_patterns - 3D structures (companies, institutions) as type field configurations
reference: urn:cfo:module:natural:epigenetics - how stress/context alters type expression over generations
urn:cfo:module:applied:memetics - idea propagation follows type-geometry resonance patterns

approach.methodology: Iterative scientific method: (1) theoretical model development, (2) small-scale experimental validation, (3) historical backtesting, (4) real-time prediction testing, (5) continuous refinement. Combines complexity science, agent-based modeling, machine learning, and geometric theory.

phases.name: Phase 0: Theoretical Foundation
deliverables: Complete mathematical formalization of psychohistory model (differential equations, agent-based rules)
Validated intertype relations matrix with confidence intervals
Context field parameter taxonomy (economic, tech, cultural, ecological, political)
Simulation architecture design document

phases.name: Phase 1: Data Foundation & Micro-Validation
deliverables: Type 1,000+ individuals across demographics (age, culture, socioeconomic status)
Run controlled experiments with 10 groups of 10-50 typed people, predict outcomes, measure accuracy
Build intertype dynamics simulation (agent-based model with 16 type classes)
Develop context field monitoring system (APIs, data pipelines, real-time dashboards)
Achieve 70%+ accuracy on small-group predictions (proof of concept)
dependencies: IRB approval for human subjects research

phases.name: Phase 2: Historical Validation & Scaling
deliverables: Mass typing campaign: 100,000+ individuals via online platforms, partnerships with universities/companies
Retroactive typing of historical populations (e.g., 1960s USA, 1990s USSR, 2010s Arab Spring regions)
Run model on historical data, compare predictions to actual outcomes (1950-2020)
Refine algorithms using machine learning on historical dataset
Publish 3-5 peer-reviewed papers demonstrating model validity
Achieve 60%+ accuracy on historical backtesting

phases.name: Phase 3: Real-Time Prediction & Deployment
deliverables: Deploy real-time prediction system for 3+ test regions (countries or large cities)
Make probabilistic forecasts (1-year, 5-year horizons) for social trends, conflicts, policy outcomes
Track actual outcomes, compare to predictions, publish accuracy metrics transparently
Build public interface: individuals can query optimal roles, organizations can optimize composition
Develop policy advisor tools for governments (ethical guidelines, transparency requirements)
Achieve 50-80% accuracy on 1-5 year forecasts

phases.name: Phase 4: Global Scaling & Continuous Improvement
deliverables: Expand to 10+ countries, diverse cultures and political systems
Integrate AI/ML for continuous model refinement based on prediction errors
Build feedback loops: system learns from deviations (5D free will events, black swans)
Establish international psychohistory consortium (open science, shared data)
Maintain 50-70% accuracy as system scales globally

projects: urn:cfo:project:research:epigenetic_typing - shows how types shift across generations
external: Access to large demographic datasets (census, social media, surveys)
Partnerships with psychology departments for typing expertise and participant pools
Compute infrastructure (cloud services or HPC clusters for agent-based simulations)
Ethical review boards approval for human subjects research
Government or foundation funding (estimated $5-10M over 5 years)

0D_individual.predictability: high when type and context known (80-90%)
0D_individual.note: Unpredictable in isolation but contributes to mass pattern

patterns.circle_7plus: requires hierarchy or devolves to chaos

types.startup: flat structure, high Ne/Se (chaos, fast iteration)

4D_society.predictability: low-to-medium for trends, high for patterns

5D_absolute.note: Mules (5D-aware individuals) can alter trajectories unpredictably
5D_absolute.function: source of genuine novelty and choice, limits of prediction

population_type_distribution.source: mass typing campaigns, proxy metrics (occupation, values surveys)
population_type_distribution.current_status: rough estimates exist, need census-level data

context_field_parameters.sources: APIs, sensors, social media analysis, news sentiment

step_1_coherence.interpretation: high coherence → stable, low coherence → tension/conflict

step_2_attractors.method: find local maxima of coherence function in state space

factors: intertype influence propagation (how types affect each other)
context field changes (external shocks, gradual shifts)
emergent tipping points (phase transitions when coherence crosses threshold)
feedback loops (predictions affect behavior if known)

step_4_uncertainty.note: accounts for measurement error, unknown unknowns, 5D free will

diagnostics.attractor_proximity: how close to each stable state

recommendations.policy: optimize governance for actual type distribution
recommendations.timing: when to introduce change (high vs low coherence periods)

crisis_cycle.mechanism: type distribution shifts in response to context
crisis_cycle.prediction: measure type shifts to forecast when crisis/revolution imminent

technology_dimension_shift.pattern: major tech → +1 dimensional access → societal restructure
technology_dimension_shift.mechanism: technology expands cognitive capacity of population
technology_dimension_shift.impact: each shift redefines social structure, power dynamics, type expression
technology_dimension_shift.prediction: track tech adoption to forecast societal reorganization timing

conflict_genesis.mechanism: incompatible geometries create tension, must reduce Δscale or fight

resolution_paths.technology: new tools shift both groups' capabilities

conflict_genesis.prediction: measure Δscale between nations/groups to forecast war probability
conflict_genesis.application: design interventions to reduce Δscale before conflict erupts

memetic_propagation.mechanism: ideas resonate with specific type geometries
memetic_propagation.prediction: given meme and population type distribution, forecast which narratives dominate
memetic_propagation.application: counter harmful memes by crafting compatible alternatives

critical.method: embed typing in national surveys, develop proxy metrics (values, occupation, social media), partner with schools/companies
critical.priority: highest - model depends entirely on this

critical.description: Does type distribution change over time/generations?
critical.target: longitudinal studies tracking populations across decades

critical.description: Live feed of context field parameters
critical.current_state: some APIs exist (economic data), others need building
critical.method: APIs (economic), web scraping (news), social media analysis (sentiment), sensor networks (ecology)
critical.priority: high - model needs current environmental state

important.method: textual analysis, biographical data, cultural artifacts
important.purpose: validate model against known historical outcomes

important.method: controlled studies with typed participants (10-1000 people)
important.purpose: validate intertype dynamics, measure prediction accuracy before scaling

large_numbers.reason: individuals unpredictable, masses statistical (law of large numbers)

closed_system.mitigation: continuous monitoring, rapid model updates when anomalies detected

reflexivity.principle: if society knows predictions, behavior changes

solutions.option_3: embrace reflexivity, use for collective optimization

measurement_error.issue: typing accuracy not 100%, context data noisy
measurement_error.mitigation: probabilistic typing with confidence intervals, error propagation analysis

state_level: Predict social movements (pre-revolutionary conditions, demographic shifts)
Optimize policy (design governance for actual type distribution, not assumed)
Prevent conflict (reduce Δscale between groups via economic/cultural intervention)
Allocate resources (match infrastructure to population needs, anticipate future demands)
corporate_level: Team composition (build optimal quadras for specific tasks, predict group dynamics)
Market prediction (forecast consumer trends based on type distribution shifts)
HR strategy (hire types aligned with company lifecycle stage, reduce turnover)
Organizational design (structure matches dominant type geometry for efficiency)
individual_level: Partner selection (identify duality/activation relationships with high success probability)
Career trajectory (match type to optimal niche, predict when to change roles)
Personal growth (understand own geometry, develop inferior functions intentionally)
Conflict resolution (recognize Δscale with others, find scale shift strategies)
research_level: Validate sociology (test existing theories with quantitative predictions)
History analysis (re-examine past events through type lens, find hidden patterns)
Futures studies (scenario planning with mathematical foundation, not speculation)
Consciousness research (bridge psychology, physics, geometry into unified science)

dangers: Mass manipulation (elite engineers society without consent)
Free will suppression (deterministic view reduces individual agency)
Psychohistorian caste (knowledge monopoly creates power imbalance)
Self-fulfilling prophecy (predictions shape reality, lose objectivity)
Weaponization (authoritarian regimes use for control, not optimization)
safeguards: Open source model and data (transparent, auditable, accessible to all)
Coherence optimization (maximize +coherence for everyone, not elite)
Informed consent (opt-in participation, explicit data usage agreements)
Diversity preservation (protect minority type geometries, avoid monoculture)
International oversight (consortium of researchers, ethicists, representatives)
Sunset clause (system shuts down if misused, built-in failsafes)

philosophical_stance.principle: Truth should be accessible with wisdom
philosophical_stance.goal: Increase global coherence, reduce suffering, enable 5D access for humanity
philosophical_stance.commitment: Serve humanity as a whole, not any particular faction

team.responsibility: Agent-based modeling, ML algorithms, data pipelines
Typing methodology, intertype validation, theory refinement
Historical analysis, context field parameters, validation
Simulation infrastructure, public interface, API development
IRB compliance, safeguards design, misuse prevention
Typing campaigns, participant engagement, public communication

tools: Agent-based modeling frameworks (Mesa, NetLogo, or custom)
Database (PostgreSQL for typed individuals, time-series context data)
resources.time_estimate: 5 years to operational system, ongoing refinement thereafter

risks.risk: Insufficient typing data (cannot reach 100K typed individuals)
risks.mitigation: Multi-pronged approach: online campaigns, university partnerships, corporate partnerships, proxy metrics if direct typing fails

risks.risk: Model accuracy lower than expected (predictions <50% accurate)
risks.mitigation: Extensive validation on small scales before scaling, historical backtesting to calibrate, accept prediction bounds (probabilities not certainties)

risks.risk: Ethical backlash (public fears manipulation, refuses participation)
risks.mitigation: Transparency, open source, informed consent, ethical oversight, demonstrate positive use cases (conflict prevention)
Open source (cannot monopolize), international consortium, built-in safeguards, public documentation of misuse risks

risks.risk: Reflexivity paradox (predictions change behavior, invalidate model)
risks.mitigation: Embrace reflexivity, model it explicitly (second-order predictions), use for optimization not just prediction

risks.risk: Black swan event (5D Mule, asteroid, AGI singularity invalidates all predictions)
risks.mitigation: Accept fundamental unpredictability, monitor for anomalies, rapid model updates, acknowledge limitations explicitly

fractal_structure.self_similarity: Psychohistory mirrors CFO pattern: individual (0D point) → relationships (1D) → groups (2D) → organizations (3D) → society (4D) → unified field (5D). Each level contains pattern of whole.
fractal_structure.emergence: From project completion emerges: (1) validated science of mass behavior, (2) policy optimization tools, (3) conflict prevention framework, (4) individual empowerment (know your role in cosmos), (5) collective self-awareness (humanity knows itself geometrically)
fractal_structure.recursion: Psychohistory feeds back into CFO: (1) validates geometric personality theory empirically, (2) extends theory to societal level, (3) provides test bed for new modules, (4) generates massive typed dataset for other research, (5) demonstrates CFO's practical impact (↓→→→↑) ∞
fractal_structure.composition: Psychohistory is one node in larger CFO ecosystem: complements personality-vision mapping (biological validation), epigenetic typing (temporal dynamics), conflict resolution (practical application). Together they form complete framework for human nature across scales.

learnings: Which personality type distributions correlate with societal stability vs chaos
How context fields (economic, tech, cultural) shift type expression over time
Limits of prediction: where 5D free will manifests most strongly
Optimal coherence levels for different societal goals (innovation vs stability)
How to communicate probabilistic predictions to public without causing panic or misuse

quantitative: 50-80% prediction accuracy on 1-5 year forecasts (core metric)
qualitative: Psychohistory transitions from fiction to science (paradigm shift)
Governments optimize policy for actual populations (evidence-based governance)
Conflicts prevented through Δscale reduction (lives saved)
Individuals understand their cosmic role (empowerment, meaning)

next_steps: Secure initial funding ($1M seed for Phase 0-1)
Launch first typing campaign (target: 1000 participants by 2026)
Publish theoretical foundation paper (establish scientific credibility)
Engage ethicists early (design safeguards from start)

warnings: Ambitious timeline (5 years) may need extension if data collection slower than expected
Funding dependency ($5-10M) requires strong grant proposals or institutional backing
Ethical complexity requires ongoing navigation, not one-time solution
info: This project represents CFO's most ambitious application: predicting mass human behavior
Success would vindicate Asimov's vision and transform social science
Failure risk is real but acceptable given transformative potential
